clinical_study.brief_title: Interprofessional Collaborative Communication in Acute Care Hospital Teams
clinical_study.official_title: The SCRIPT Programme (GIM): Structuring Communication Relationships for Interprofessional Teamwork to Achieve Interprofessional Education for Collaborative Patient-Centered Practice (IECPCP)

brief_summary.textblock: Collaborative practice may improve patient outcomes in specific disease conditions and health care settings. The SCRIPT Programme is an intervention to implement informal, but structured, communication etiquette between members of interprofessional ward-based clinical teaching units (CTUs) in General Internal Medicine (GIM) hospital divisions.

primary_outcome.measure: unplanned hospital readmission 7 days post-discharge and 30 days post-discharge

secondary_outcome.measure: length of stay in hospital for GIM patients' index admission
measurement survey of staff members' perceptions of interprofessional collaboration
patient satisfaction measured by a large standardized, cross-site survey regime
calls placed to staff members' paging devices
use of evidence-based, optimal prescription drug therapy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients admitted to divisions of General Internal Medicine
- Health care providers working in divisions of General Internal Medicine
